meanings.definition: A Jewish commentary or interpretation of biblical texts.
meanings.sent1: The rabbi shared a fascinating midrash about the story of Moses.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often study midrashim to gain deeper insights into the scriptures.
meanings.sent3: During the holiday gathering, Sarah entertained everyone with a humorous midrash she had heard.
meanings.sent4: The midrash shed new light on the ancient text, revealing hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: The colorful midrash painted a vivid picture of the biblical narrative.

meanings.definition: To interpret or explain biblical texts in a creative or imaginative way.
meanings.sent1: She loved to midrash the stories from the Torah, adding her own creative twists.
meanings.sent2: As a teacher, he encouraged his students to midrash freely, exploring different interpretations.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to midrash the story in their own silly manner.
meanings.sent4: His ability to midrash the ancient texts made him a respected scholar in the community.
meanings.sent5: The author's unique way to midrash the scriptures captivated readers around the world.
